data.title: Usage message for search should be updated.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open search from action-bar.
2. Launch advance search and verify usage message.

Actual:
1. Usage message contents should be updated for folder as well. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15349087/bfdefc72-1c84-11e6-8e1c-a10a5b6c8344.png)

Like: 
Files and folders to include (multiple values separated by comma).
Files and folders to exclude. (multiple values separated by comma)
Files and folders excluded through Search.exclude setting.
1. There are two setting for file and folder exclusion:  file.exclude and search.exclude , user should get clear idea from usage message which property they need to set for search exclusion.
2. There is no hint how to provide multiple values.

It would be great if we can open the settings.json in edited mode with search.exclude setting without any property when user click on gear icon.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15349451/c3b10d1a-1c87-11e6-85a3-05904c71472a.png)

data.title: Quick open is not displaying all the matching files.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version:Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open smoke test project folder.
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-smoketest-express
2. Run "npm install" and "npm install vscode".
3. Launch quick open window by pressing CTRL+P.
4. Enter patter to get info about all the typing files like *.d.ts
5. Verify result for typings file (.d.ts).

Actual: Not getting all the files.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15348012/b0165b90-1c7b-11e6-921e-577287d16e91.png)

Expected: Should display all the files.

Note: On my MAC machine it is working fine.

data.title: Allow decorations on empty characters

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Indent guide-related extensions have issues keeping blocks continuously styled because they can't add decorations to empty lines. Is there some way we could enable this? It would be able to have an ideal implementation of indent guides (#2192) encapsulated within an extension.
- https://github.com/spywhere/vscode-guides/issues/1
- https://github.com/oderwat/vscode-indent-rainbow/issues/7

data.title: Terminal: constant high CPU usage once terminal is open
data.body: Seeing this on Mac, as soon as I open the terminal, CPU of the renderer is at constant 100%. This might be https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/38

data.title: Open in Command Prompt doesn't open cwd when using cmder
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install cmder
2. Set externalTerminal.windowsExec as cmder.exe path
3. Right click on explorer folder and select Open in Command Prompt, notice the user dir is opened, not the selected folder.

data.title: Allow accepting `--ours` or `--theirs` when resolving merge conflicts

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: When resolving merge conflicts I often use `git checkout --theirs /path/to/file` or `git checkout --ours file` to resolve a conflict. It would be great if VSCode allows you to do those commands from the UI.

data.title: Wrong type of comments for React code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. position cursor on a line of react html
2. press ctrl-/  to comment out the line

It will insert // instead of {/\*    */}

data.title: Do something smarter when the integrated terminal is exited
data.body:
Integrated terminal master issue: #143

Currently it breaks the panel and you cannot use it anymore without a restart. Related #6458

data.title: Reflect integrated terminal's current process title in UI
data.body: Integrated terminal master issue: #143

data.title: Support multiple integrated terminals
data.body: Integrated terminal master issue: #143

data.title: vim overrides the terminal color scheme
data.body:
Integrated terminal master issue: #143

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Toggle terminal
2. Launch vim (color scheme changes)
3. Exit vim (vim's changed color scheme remains)

data.title: Determine terminal character size in a font-agnostic way
data.body:
Integrated terminal master issue: #143

The width/height of the terminal is currently based on a hard coded character size, this needs to be based on the character size in the monospace font being used.

data.title: Should escape be consumed by the integrated terminal?
data.body:
Integrated terminal master issue: #143

Open question: Currently pressing <kbd>esc</kbd> will hide the terminal, this can be a problem for some terminal programs, for example `vim`. Perhaps this should be configurable?

data.title: Investigate integrated terminal cmd support
data.body:
Integrated terminal master issue: #143

Apparently the new and improved `cmd` on Windows 10 has issues with pty.js.

data.title: Support and test basics of integrated terminal on Windows
data.body:
Integrated terminal master issue: #143

Resolve code signing issue and verify Powershell works as a minimum.

data.title: Add toggle terminal to View menu
data.body:
Integrated terminal master issue: #143

This should be done once the terminal is enabled in stable.

data.title: Support copy and paste via keyboard on integrated terminal
data.body:
Integrated terminal master issue: #143

Might need to use custom keybindings, <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>c</kbd> terminates a process. Also it's probably not best to hijack <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>c</kbd> from open in new terminal.

data.title: Allow custom integrated terminal background and foreground colors
data.body:
Integrated terminal master issue: #143

Currently `#CCC` and `#1e1e1e` for dark and `#333` and `#FFF` for light are hard coded.

data.title: vscode.d.ts version 1.1.0 not available (empty)?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

The `engine` attribute defines the VSCode _compatible version_ for the extension. Since I would like to limit the extension to work with at least version `1.1.0`, I tried to use it, but the `vscode.d.ts` downloads empty

Steps to reproduce:

1) Define `engine` as: 

``` json
"engines": {
  "vscode": "^1.1.0"
},
```

2) Define `devDependencies` as:

``` json
"devDependencies": {
  "vscode": "^0.11.x",
  "typescript": "^1.6.2"
}
```

3) Run `npm install`
4) Besides the command outputs no error, as you can see in the log below, the `vscode.d.ts` in `node_modules` is empty:

```
> project-manager@0.6.0 postinstall C:\Users\alefr\Documents\GitHub\vscode-project-manager
> node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/install

Detected VS Code engine version: ^1.1.0
Found minimal version that qualifies engine range: 1.1.0
Fetching vscode.d.ts from: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Microsoft/vscode/1.1.0/src/vs/vscode.d.ts
vscode.d.ts successfully installed!
```

5) `vscode.d.ts` contents in `node_modules\vscode`

```
Not Found
export = vscode;
```

If I use `^1.0.0` it works, but I can't use this version, because only version 1.1.0 has the new `vscode.openFolder` command.

Thanks for your help.

data.title: Editor indentation autodetection not working and manually set indentation keeps getting reset
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 15.10 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. User settings set like so: 
   "editor.tabSize": 2, 
   "editor.insertSpaces": true,
   "editor.detectIndentation":true,
2. Open a C/C++ project with 4 space indentation. 
3. Open a file in the project, observe on the status bar Spaces:2 (expected: Spaces: 4)
4. Click on the Spaces:2 setting in the status bar and select "Detect Indentation from Content". 
5. Observe that the status bar now says Spaces: 4. 
6. Switch to a different file with indentation of 4 spaces, it doesn't seem to matter. 
7. Observe that the status bar now say Spaces: 2 (expected: Spaces: 4) 
8. Switch back to the original file, observe that the status bar still stays Spaces: 2 (expected: spaces 4)

I've seen similar behavior with Makefiles and tabs, I manually switch to tab mode and every time I toggle back and forth from another file the tab mode is reset to spaces.

data.title: Extension-development-host is not terminating when closing debug session from main process.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch an app.
2. Follow the instructions to create and debug extension.
   https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensions/example-word-count
   1. Start debugging with F5 and verify new instance of VSCode launched or not.
   2. From the main window (where debug options are available) perform search from action-bar and click on close debug button from debug-actions widget.

**Actual**: When user terminate the debug session after search operation then child window (Extension-development-host) is not closing.

**Expected**: Whenever user close the debug session then all the child processes and threads associated with that should be terminated.
I tried to perform below operations without search action and Child process is terminating properly.
1. Close debug session from main process and verify app behavior (new instance of VSCode closed when ending debug session).
2. Try to perform in either way, Close newly launched VSCode instance and verify app behavior (Debug session terminated)

![extensiondev-hostclosingissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15341272/8d28186e-1c42-11e6-8d96-1620819d4fc1.gif)

data.title: Can't modify each file when comparing two different files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In the Explorer viewlet, right click on a file > Select for Compare
2. Right click another file > Compare with 'selected.js'
3. Try to modify the first file (left side compare window)

It makes sense when comparing the changes of a single file, but when two different files are being compared you should be able to modify the first opened one.
